s.text: But companies are getting much better, not worse, at treating each consumer differently, which means, in some sense, becoming a different company for everyone who buys from them.
If anything, then, a tax system in which everyone paid his or her own particular tax rate would be more in tune with our world, and the possibilities created by the computer, than the flat tax.
The real one-price-fits-all days, in fact, were the days when only AT&T provided long distance.
The real one-price-fits-all days, in fact, were the days when only AT&T provided long distance.
When it came to pay, we used to live in a world of job classifications and pay grades, where everyone who did the "same" work got the same pay.
Increasingly, we now live in a world of dramatic differentiation in pay.
And all the loopholes make a "nominally progressive" system much less fair than it appears, and much less fair than a one-size-fits-all system.
And all the loopholes make a "nominally progressive" system much less fair than it appears, and much less fair than a one-size-fits-all system.
And all the loopholes make a "nominally progressive" system much less fair than it appears, and much less fair than a one-size-fits-all system.
For Sullivan, the "byzantine" nature of the current tax system benefits the wealthy, who can afford to pay people to decipher it.
For Sullivan, the "byzantine" nature of the current tax system benefits the wealthy, who can afford to pay people to decipher it.

And all the loopholes make a "nominally progressive" system much less fair than it appears, and much less fair than a one-size-fits-all system.
